instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHGR_CSO_N: What is CHGR_CSO_N? CHGR_CSO_N is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_N and CHGR_CSO_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSO_P: What is CHGR_CSO_P? CHGR_CSO_P is one of the current sense lines for the battery. Resistance between CHGR_CSO_P and CHGR_CSO_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 2.2 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_P: What is CHGR_CSI_P? CHGR_CSI_P is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_P and CHGR_CSI_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CELL: What is CHGR_CELL? CHGR_CELL is a signal going to the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 battery charging chip that sets PPBUS_G3H voltage. Macbook Airs with 2 cells in series  in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 8.15v to 8.55v, Macbooks & Macbook Pros with 3 cells in series in their batteries will have PPBUS_G3H voltages of 12.23 to 12.56v..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message:
[B][SIZE=12px]Hi, iv got a MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which will run fine on the charger, (it auto powers on when plugged in), but when the charger is unplugged it turns off. No green light is shown on the charger.

When the mac came to me it looked like it had sustained water damage to the dc in board as some of the components were corroded, but the motherboard itself looks fine.[/SIZE][/B]

Iv tried 2x different chargers and 2x different dc in boards and it still wont charge. The battery has been changed and when it had charge in it the mac would run fine off the battery alone, until it went flat, then wont charge again, the mac reports the battery percentage correctly.

I have replaced <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> also and still have the same problem.

The board has had some water damage at one point, but this seems to be only on the dc in board, the rest of the motherboard appears to be fine.


[B]Here are some voltages from around <CHIP>ISL6250</CHIP> :[/B]

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_P</SIGNAL>
14.50v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_N</SIGNAL>
14.45v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_BOOT</SIGNAL>
12.89v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL>
10.95

<SIGNAL>PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP</SIGNAL>
5.05v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_N</SIGNAL>
8.36v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSO_P</SIGNAL>
8.36v

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>
2.97v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_L</SIGNAL>
3.3v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_VNEG_R</SIGNAL>
1.3v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP_R</SIGNAL>
1.3v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL>
14.2v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL>
3.74v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_ICOMP</SIGNAL>
1.54v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CELL</SIGNAL>
0v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP</SIGNAL>
1.52v

<SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP_R</SIGNAL>
1.44v

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
3.39v

[B]Resistors tested :[/B]

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> = 14.1v & 14.35v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7080</RESISTOR> = 14.69v & 5.57v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7001</RESISTOR> = 5.1v & 5.05v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7085</RESISTOR> = 14.62v & 5.7v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R5420</RESISTOR> = 0.061v & 0.061v
Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> = 14.65v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> = 14.60v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> = 14.60v

Voltage @ <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> = 8.36v

Voltage @ L6995 = 8.36v (=<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>)



EDIT >>>>>

So iv just tested <RESISTOR>R5311</RESISTOR> and also <RESISTOR>R5312</RESISTOR> and im getting 85k and 88k . Im testing in circuit so im not sure if im getting some measurement problem, or if you think these two could be the problem ?,

also <RESISTOR>R5313</RESISTOR> is 25.30k instead of 27.4k , <RESISTOR>R5314</RESISTOR> is correct rating.

@ <TRANSISTOR>Q5410</TRANSISTOR> - <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL> = 2.83v
<SIGNAL>DCINVSENS_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>DCIN_S5_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 14.59v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_S5_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 14.62v
PDCINVSENS_EN_L_DIV = 7.18
<SIGNAL>DCINVSENS_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message: Tried a known good inboard flat cable too? Must have light on the charger or it will never charge.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message: Hi, what in board flat cable ?, the dc in board plugs straight into the motherboard, I cant see any other cables on this board  ?.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
[SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message: The flat cable that is missing, goes over the fan to the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message:
Thanks !, il take the dunce hat and go sit in the corner !, looks like it was the cable.....as in not plugged in. so it was probably the dc in board or isl chip that was faulty then as it came to me plugged in and assembled.

Its my first Mac logic board issue, so glad the last part of the puzzle was something obvious !.

il try it with the battery tomorrow, but I'm sure it'll work now as had no green light when drooord off to me.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Air 11" (Mid 2011) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Runs off charger but wont charge
threads.message: This is confirmed fixed, so all good :) . Looks like the bad dc in board fried the isl chip, and the battery was also bad, but all working now.
